reinforcement:
⚠️ PRODUCTIVITY FOCUS — KEY RULES FOR IMAGE GENERATION:
- CRITICAL: The Table/Desk MUST be pushed flush against the wall that has the window. If no window, place it on the wall OPPOSITE the door so it's the first thing visible on entry. The table/desk is the HERO piece.
- Position the Table/Desk so that it is on the straight line from the door to the opposite wall. Chairs go between the table and room center.
- CRITICAL: The Bed MUST be in the corner FURTHEST from both the door AND the table/desk. Headboard flush against wall. Bed should NOT be the first thing you see entering.
- If the bed is currently near the table/desk or near the door, it MUST be relocated to a different wall entirely.
- Nightstands follow the bed to its NEW position.
- Sofa flat against a side wall that is NOT the table/desk wall and NOT the bed wall. Keep center path door→table clear.
- When someone opens the door, the FIRST thing they should see is the Table/Desk and work area, NOT the bed.
- Clear straight walking path from door to table/desk.
- The output MUST look visibly DIFFERENT from the input image.
exclusion_zones:
⚠️ EXCLUSION ZONES — furniture MUST NOT overlap these fixed fixtures:
  - refrigerator (refrigerator_1): fixed at top (north)-left (west). NO furniture here.
  - kitchen counter (kitchen_counter_1): fixed at top (north)-left (west). NO furniture here.
  - shower (shower_1): fixed at top (north)-right (east). NO furniture here.
full_prompt:
TASK: Edit this 2D top-down floor plan to show the "Productivity Focus" arrangement.

╔══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════╗
║  ⚠️  STRICT RULES                                            ║
╠══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════╣
║  1. Exactly 13 movable items must appear.           ║
║  2. REQUIRED: [table, chair, chair, sofa, artwork, bed, nightstand, nightstand, plant, lamp, artwork, rug, rug]                             ║
║  3. DO NOT ADD or REMOVE any furniture.                      ║
║  4. DOOR (north (top) at ~46%): 2+ feet clear.               ║
║  5. DO NOT MOVE: [refrigerator, cabinet, kitchen counter, sink, stovetop, door, sink, sink, toilet, shower, shelf, window, window, window]                             ║
║  6. OUTPUT = 2D TOP-DOWN VIEW (not 3D).                      ║
╚══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════╝

⚠️ DO NOT DUPLICATE FURNITURE:
- This room has exactly: 1 table, 2 chairs, 1 sofa, 2 artworks, 1 bed, 2 nightstands, 1 plant, 1 lamp, 2 rugs.
- MOVE = ERASE from old spot + PLACE in new spot. Do NOT copy.
- If the same item appears in TWO places, the output is INVALID.
- COUNT each furniture type before finishing. Counts must match input.

⚠️ EXCLUSION ZONES — furniture MUST NOT overlap these fixed fixtures:
  - refrigerator (refrigerator_1): fixed at top (north)-left (west). NO furniture here.
  - kitchen counter (kitchen_counter_1): fixed at top (north)-left (west). NO furniture here.
  - shower (shower_1): fixed at top (north)-right (east). NO furniture here.

STYLE: Productivity Focus
This layout establishes a clear hierarchy by making the work area the focal point. The table is positioned directly opposite the entrance against the windowed wall, creating a commanding and inspiring workspace. The bed is intentionally relocated to the furthest, most secluded corner to minimize its presence and promote a work-first mindset, while the sofa is placed to the side to maintain a clear, direct path to the desk.

FURNITURE PLACEMENT — FOLLOW EXACTLY:
  • TABLE_1: Centered on the south wall, pushed flush against it between the two windows. This serves as the primary desk and workspace.
  • CHAIR_1: Placed at the desk (table_1) on the west side, with its back to the center of the room.
  • CHAIR_2: Placed at the desk (table_1) on the east side, with its back to the center of the room.
  • BED_1: In the south-east corner of the room, with the headboard against the east wall. This position is furthest from the entry door and not in the direct line of sight.
  • NIGHTSTAND_1: Positioned to the south of bed_1, between the head of the bed and the south wall.
  • NIGHTSTAND_2: Positioned to the north of bed_1, on the other side of the bed.
  • SOFA_1: Pushed flush against the west wall, positioned south of the kitchenette to keep the main walkway clear.
  • ARTWORK_1: Mounted on the west wall, centered above sofa_1.
  • ARTWORK_2: Mounted on the east wall, centered above the headboard of bed_1.
  • PLANT_1: Placed in the north-east corner of the room, near the bathroom door, to fill the space and add visual interest without obstructing traffic.
  • LAMP_1: Placed on nightstand_2.
  • RUG_1: A single area rug centered on the south wall, positioned under the desk (table_1) and chairs to define the workspace.
  • RUG_2: None

ZONES:
  • work_zone: The work zone is the primary focus, located at the south end of the room against the windowed wall. It is the first area visible upon entering the room.
  • sleep_zone: The sleep zone is discreetly tucked into the north-east corner, the furthest point from both the door and the work zone, to separate rest from work.
  • living_zone: The living zone is situated along the west wall, creating a distinct area for relaxation that does not impede the main circulation path to the work zone.

⚠️ PRODUCTIVITY FOCUS — KEY RULES FOR IMAGE GENERATION:
- CRITICAL: The Table/Desk MUST be pushed flush against the wall that has the window. If no window, place it on the wall OPPOSITE the door so it's the first thing visible on entry. The table/desk is the HERO piece.
- Position the Table/Desk so that it is on the straight line from the door to the opposite wall. Chairs go between the table and room center.
- CRITICAL: The Bed MUST be in the corner FURTHEST from both the door AND the table/desk. Headboard flush against wall. Bed should NOT be the first thing you see entering.
- If the bed is currently near the table/desk or near the door, it MUST be relocated to a different wall entirely.
- Nightstands follow the bed to its NEW position.
- Sofa flat against a side wall that is NOT the table/desk wall and NOT the bed wall. Keep center path door→table clear.
- When someone opens the door, the FIRST thing they should see is the Table/Desk and work area, NOT the bed.
- Clear straight walking path from door to table/desk.
- The output MUST look visibly DIFFERENT from the input image.

DOOR CLEARANCE: The central corridor from the door on the north wall to the table on the south wall is kept completely clear, ensuring an unobstructed path and line of sight to the work area. No furniture is placed in the door's swing path.

STRUCTURAL (fixed): Door=north (top) at ~46%, Window=interior at ~50%, Others=[refrigerator, cabinet, kitchen counter, sink, stovetop, door, sink, sink, toilet, shower, shelf, window, window, window]

OUTPUT: Same 2D style as input, all 13 items in their NEW positions, professional floor plan.
Do NOT place furniture on top of kitchen appliances, bathroom fixtures, or any structural element.
Edit the floor plan to show "Productivity Focus".
